summary: This is an internal email from the SDNY Criminal Division, dated August 25, 2019, outlining the schedule for the upcoming week. It notes the sender is on vacation until Thursday and mentions an 'Epstein conference' scheduled for Wednesday, August 28, 2019, among other case-related events.

persons.name: Fitts
persons.role: Defendant in a civil rights case
persons.context: Subject of a civil rights case against a Dept of Homeless Services sergeant for kicking/stomping a person seeking assistance.

persons.name: Abrams
persons.context: Mentioned in relation to the Fitts civil rights case.

persons.name: Sanchez
persons.context: Subject of an 'Ammolock' case before Judge Broderick.

persons.name: Broderick
persons.context: Presiding judge over the Sanchez Ammolock case.

persons.name: Borge
persons.context: Subject of a sentencing in the College of New Rochelle case.

persons.name: Michael Hild
persons.context: Subject of an arrest in the LiveWell Financial case.

events.title: Epstein conference
events.description: A conference related to the Jeffrey Epstein case is scheduled.

events.title: Start of Sanchez Ammolock case trial
events.description: Trial for the Sanchez Ammolock case begins before Judge Broderick.

events.title: First Day of unspecified proceedings
events.description: Marked as 'First Day' on the schedule.

events.title: Borge sentencing
events.description: Sentencing of defendant Borge in the College of New Rochelle case.

events.title: Arrest of Michael Hild
events.description: Arrest scheduled for Michael Hild in the LiveWell Financial case.

keyFacts: The document is an internal SDNY Criminal Division email dated August 25, 2019, outlining the office schedule for the week of August 26-30, 2019.
It specifically schedules an 'Epstein conference' for Wednesday, August 28, 2019, indicating ongoing legal proceedings related to Jeffrey Epstein at that time.
The sender notes they are on vacation and returning on Thursday, August 29, 2019, and expects the week to be 'pretty quiet' aside from the listed events.
The schedule includes multiple other unrelated cases (Fitts, Sanchez, Borge, LiveWell Financial), showing the routine caseload of the SDNY office.
The document's existence (EFTA00077359) suggests it was part of a document production related to the Epstein case investigations.
